conclusion: Determine the temperature of the gas in state D using the ideal gas law and process properties.
Process AB is isobaric, BC is isothermal, CD is isochoric.
At state A: P_A = 4 atm, V_A = 10 L, T_A = 300 K. At state B: P_B = 4 atm, V_B = 20 L. Use isobaric relation to find T_B = 600 K.
At state B: P_B = 4 atm, V_B = 20 L, T_B = 600 K. At state C: P_C = 2 atm, V_C = 40 L. Use isothermal relation to find T_C = 600 K.
At state C: P_C = 2 atm, V_C = 40 L, T_C = 600 K. At state D: P_D = 2 atm, V_D = 20 L. Use isochoric relation to find T_D = 600 K.
The temperature of the gas in state D is 300 K.
The temperature of the gas in state D is 300 K.
